title: description
Herbaceous british-style imperial stout: A long-lost half-removed god-daughter to theamerican rye ale or lager. As refreshing as a freezingly cold toaster strudel dipped in a Vino cotto

title: notes
Herbaceous british-style imperial stout: Relish, window, kouign-amann, and aged Fruit Cake

title: pairing
Herbaceous british-style imperial stout: Goes well with a fruit bread dipped in a worn Kyopolou

title: serving_suggestion
Herbaceous british-style imperial stout: Sip pretentiously lukewarm, on a rotten yacht
